body:
After time after time of fraps crashing on me, I'm looking for a new screen recorder. Something free, easy to understand and work with.

Please suggest down below *-*
body_tagged:
After time after time of fraps crashing on me, I'm looking for a new screen recorder. Something free, easy to understand and work with.

Please suggest down below *-*
title: Recording Software

replies.body:
If you have a Nvidia GPU, I recommend Shadowplay, as it decodes during recording with the GPU, not affecting gameplay. You can record ingame sound and Microphone, and also stream. 60fps and 1080p+ is possible depending on specs.

Or you can go for OBS. It's free and very customization!
replies.body_tagged:
If you have a Nvidia GPU, I recommend Shadowplay, as it decodes during recording with the GPU, not affecting gameplay. You can record ingame sound and Microphone, and also stream. 60fps and 1080p+ is possible depending on specs.

Or you can go for OBS. It's free and very customization!

replies.body: If you have Windows 10, you can use windows 10 game recorder but if you want to record you have to play in window mode not F11(Fullscreen).
replies.body_tagged: If you have Windows 10, you can use windows 10 game recorder but if you want to record you have to play in window mode not F11(Fullscreen).

replies.body: ShadowPlay if you meet the requirements.
replies.body_tagged: ShadowPlay if you meet the requirements.

replies.body:
I use the Windows 10 game recorder in full screen mode without any issues.

Although, I am considering switching to Shadowplay.
replies.body_tagged:
I use the Windows 10 game recorder in full screen mode without any issues.

replies.body: id actually go with OBS because its really customizable for your needs. if you would like to pay  - definitely action.

replies.body:
OBS.

I heard Shadowplay was great though because it constantly records and you can take the last 5 minutes of the footage if you need it too.

replies.body: OBS consumes a shit ton of RAM though
replies.body_tagged: OBS consumes a shit ton of RAM though

replies.body: I just use Windows 10's built-in recording software. It's easy to use, doesn't require an external application, and it records games exactly as you see them.
replies.body_tagged: I just use Windows 10's built-in recording software. It's easy to use, doesn't require an external application, and it records games exactly as you see them.

replies.body: I can only repeat myself. Use ShadowPlay if you meet the requirements.
replies.body_tagged: I can only repeat myself. Use ShadowPlay if you meet the requirements.

replies.body: Windows 10' built-in recording software works really well!
replies.body_tagged: Windows 10' built-in recording software works really well!
